executive_summary.summary_text: The security scan identified 3 vulnerabilities, including 1 CRITICAL and 1 HIGH severity findings that require immediate attention.

findings.title: SQL Injection in 'id' parameter
findings.description: An error-based SQL injection vulnerability allows attackers to execute arbitrary SQL queries.

risk_score.exploitability: Directly exploitable. Can extract entire database contents.

evidence.description: MySQL error: 'You have an error in your SQL syntax near '1'='1''

proof_of_concept.response_snippet: MySQL error: 'You have an error in your SQL syntax...'

evidence.ai_analysis: High confidence SQL injection confirmed via error messages and boolean-based testing.

remediation.summary: Use parameterized queries (prepared statements) instead of string concatenation.
remediation.code_example:
# Vulnerable code:
query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = '{user_id}'"

# Secure code:
query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?"
cursor.execute(query, (user_id,))

findings.title: Reflected XSS in search parameter
findings.description: User input is reflected in HTML without proper encoding, allowing script injection.

risk_score.exploitability: Requires user interaction but easily exploitable via phishing.

evidence.description: Payload <script>alert('XSS')</script> was reflected unencoded in response.
evidence.ai_analysis: Confirmed reflected XSS via payload reflection analysis.

remediation.summary: HTML-encode all user input before rendering in web pages. Use Content-Security-Policy header.

findings.title: Missing CSRF protection on profile update
findings.description: State-changing operation lacks CSRF tokens, allowing cross-site request forgery.

risk_score.exploitability: Requires social engineering but no authentication bypass needed.

evidence.description: POST request succeeded without CSRF token or SameSite cookie attribute.
evidence.ai_analysis: No CSRF tokens found in request or response. Cookies lack SameSite attribute.

remediation.summary: Implement synchronizer tokens pattern. Set SameSite=Strict on session cookies.
